body:
Running `spack buildcache update-index --keys` or `spack buildcache create --rebuild-index` fails with a stack trace if the mirror doesn't have any keys.  However, it seems like it should not be an error to attempt to update the keys index if there are no keys, instead spack should just print a warning indicating there were no keys found and not exit with an error code or exception.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
root@5bcb4d8da0f8:/# spack --version
0.15.4-1311-09d0623be
root@5bcb4d8da0f8:/work# spack mirror add amirror s3://some-bucket/mirror-with-no-keys
root@5bcb4d8da0f8:/# spack -d buildcache update-index --keys -d s3://some-bucket/mirror-with-no-keys
==> [2020-10-07-15:16:41.028326] Imported buildcache from built-in commands
==> [2020-10-07-15:16:41.031261] Imported buildcache from built-in commands
==> [2020-10-07-15:16:41.032513] Reading config file /work/spack/etc/spack/defaults/mirrors.yaml
==> [2020-10-07-15:16:41.034770] Reading config file /root/.spack/mirrors.yaml
==> [2020-10-07-15:16:41.036442] Reading config file /root/.spack/linux/mirrors.yaml
==> [2020-10-07-15:16:41.038776] Reading config file /work/spack/etc/spack/defaults/config.yaml
==> [2020-10-07-15:16:41.058556] DATABASE LOCK TIMEOUT: 3s
==> [2020-10-07-15:16:41.058654] PACKAGE LOCK TIMEOUT: No timeout
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/work/spack/bin/spack", line 64, in <module>
    sys.exit(spack.main.main())
  File "/work/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 762, in main
    return _invoke_command(command, parser, args, unknown)
  File "/work/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 490, in _invoke_command
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/work/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/buildcache.py", line 793, in buildcache
    args.func(args)
  File "/work/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/buildcache.py", line 781, in buildcache_update_index
    url_util.join(outdir, bindist.build_cache_relative_path()))
  File "/work/spack/lib/spack/spack/binary_distribution.py", line 303, in generate_package_index
    for entry in web_util.list_url(cache_prefix)
  File "/work/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/web.py", line 321, in list_url
    for key in _iter_s3_prefix(s3, url)))
  File "/work/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/web.py", line 320, in <genexpr>
    key.split('/', 1)[0]
  File "/work/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/web.py", line 289, in _iter_s3_prefix
    client, bucket, prefix, num_entries, start_after=key)
  File "/work/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/web.py", line 277, in _list_s3_objects
    iter = _iter_s3_contents(result['Contents'], prefix)
KeyError: 'Contents'
```

### Information on your system

```
root@5bcb4d8da0f8:/# spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.15.4-1311-09d0623be
* **Python:** 3.6.9
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu18.04-haswell
```

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
title: Update buildcache keys index on S3 fails if there are no keys
